intro: Boechera paddoensis, commonly known as Paddo rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Boechera paddoensis is also notable for its potential role in plant biology research due to its genetic diversity and adaptability.
